bioghist.p: The firm of William F. Comly and Son, Inc. was founded in Philadelphia by Samuel Comly in 1834. Its origins, however, date back several years earlier when Comly first began to do business as a commission merchant in the city's old historical waterfront district. It is the oldest family owned and operated auction firm in the United States.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of the auction house Wm. F. Comly & Son, Inc. Volumes include: record of sales volumes, 1836-1904; store list books, 1869-1905; outside sales books, 1869-1905; fruit sales books, 1883-1887; cigar sales books, 1888-1906; ledgers, 1877-1906; cash books, 1869-1900; journals, 1874-1888; receipt books,1854-1930; letter books, 1873-1908, 1918; Ad books, 1880-1906; and 8 additional volumes. Volumes documenting the company's operations particularly in the first two decades of the twentieth century include: inventory, 1885-1888; address book, 1883; outside sales book, 1877-1882; store list books, 1905-1914; outside list books, 1904-1914; cigar sale list books, 1906-1916; letter press books, 1906-1918; cash books, 1903-1921; ledger, 1907-1936; record of sales books, 1905-1937; and a journal, 1908-1931. The collection also includes correspondence, receipts, and invoices, as well as bills of lading, insurance policies, catalogs, postcards, and other items. Correspondents include firms around the United States, in England, and in France.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
